chargeHist.descr: Battery to Law Enforcement Officers, Fire Fighters or Commission Wardens

result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: DE competent to stand trial, suspension lifted

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Barry L Burge in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Barry L Burge in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The Court has received a report from Dr. Munizza. Parties have received and reviewed that document. The doctor opines that the defendant is competent to proceed. The Court indicates the letter from the doctor appears to request an order from the Court that the defendant continue to take his medication. The State concurs. The Defense objects, feeling the defendant can take his medication w/o an order of this Court.

BTC: Deft is competent to proceed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)
Review hearing on June 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Barry L Burge in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Barry L Burge in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Parties are in receipt of letter from Dr. Deborah Collins. Neither party object to the findings. The opinion is that deft is not competent to proceed but could regain competency within the statutory period and he is not competent to refuse treatment or medication.

BTC: deft is not competent to proceed but could regain competency within the statutory period and he is not competent to refuse treatment or medication.
          Involuntary medication administration is ordered. Defendant is to be transported to a State mental hospital  Review hearing scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
